reviews.text: Efficiently run station with friendly staff and pleasant surroundings.  This is how every travel experience should go.

The staff at the train station were friendly and suggested travelling off peak to Edinburgh to save money.  Comfortable short wait.   Train can be a but crowded in the peak season. e g.  Edinburgh festival and Tattoo.  Dog friendly.
Not a bad station. They have a good few places to stay out of the rain and have a wh smiths however only open during 9:00-17:00 hours that I'm aware of

Rebuilt station buildings, except whoever designed it ought to refund their wages. Has all expected functions and services of a community train station, with long wide platforms, staff on site, and limited hours convenience store. Alas, the station buildings, especially the southbound Edinburgh side, are somewhat a joke. Entrances are poorly positioned, both into the building and onto the platforms, bizarrely placed on the angle. Three ticket windows yet a cramped foyer. Limited canopy cover, of little use for 10 coach mainline East Coast services that call here. Knock it down and start again.
Love this station use it for nearly all my train journeys
